content.description:
This route is short but very strong. It shares a start with

Persnickety

. It is lightly overhung for the first half. Go left at the top of the ramp. It is slopey and bouldery for the first half and crimpy and sharp for the second.

climbs.name: Persnickety
climbs.fa: Steph Johnson, Richard Kocurek. (Edwin Foster, 1st TR)

content.description:
It shares the start of

Rogue Repeater

. At the obvious crux, go right up the overhanging wall. It has high quality, sustained climbing from the ramp to the anchors.

This is the obvious arete to the right of

Rogue Repeater

and

Persnickety

. It only has 2 bolts. You need a cam and some creativity to protect it. The difficulty eases up towards the top. It has good quality rock. I'm not a fan of the protection.
content.protection: 2 bolts, a cam and some imagination.

content.description: Start scrambling up to the ledge where the climb actually starts. Go left under over roof following bolts to delicate face climbing.
content.protection: 7 bolts to anchors; gear to 2 inches protects the direct start

content.description:
Despite the name, this is a surprisingly clean and fun crack climb with varied movement throughout. Itâ€™s a great warm-up for the Rogue area, and it shares anchors with

Persnickety

. The crux is pulling through a bulge near the end of the route and is significantly easier than the crux of

Adament Eve

.
content.protection: A singles rack with doubles of handish-sized pieces.
content.location:
It ascends the obvious crack system right of the trio of bolted face climbs (

The Filler

,

Rogue Repeater

, and

Persnickety

).

content.description: Start in a shallow thin crack corner just left of a tree. Move up to fun positive face climbing that leads to a wide roof.
content.protection: Some small gear is required to protect the face climbing. Bring a standard rack.
content.location:
You can use the anchors for the

Filler

or make a trad anchor.
